title: Trojan (HEUR:Trojan.Script.Miner.gen) no Mozilla Thunderbird
content:
Assunto: Relato de detecção de Trojan (HEUR:Trojan.Script.Miner.gen) no Mozilla Thunderbird

Olá, equipe de suporte da comunidade Mozilla Thunderbird,

Estou enfrentando um problema sério com o Mozilla Thunderbird instalado no meu computador (Windows). Meu antivírus, Kaspersky Free, detectou repetidamente uma ameaça classificada como "HEUR:Trojan.Script.Miner.gen" associada ao Thunderbird. As detecções começaram em 9 de julho de 2021 e continuaram até hoje, 22 de maio de 2025.

As notificações indicam que o comportamento suspeito está relacionado a arquivos de dados do Thunderbird, localizados em C:\Users\[User]\AppData\Roaming\Thunderbird\Profiles\7933zk1m.default-release-1\Mail\pop-mail.outlook.com\.... O antivírus identificou que o programa está tentando realizar mineração de criptomoedas, o que me preocupa bastante em termos de segurança e privacidade.

Gostaria de saber se isso é um problema conhecido com o Thunderbird e se há alguma solução oficial para resolver essa questão. Estou usando a versão mais recente do programa, e meu sistema está atualizado. Caso necessário, posso fornecer mais detalhes ou logs do antivírus.

Aguardo uma resposta o mais breve possível, pois estou considerando desinstalar o Thunderbird devido a esse problema.

Obrigado(a),
creator: walacecamargo2024

title: Restore extensions (including extension data)
content:
I am signed-in to my Firefox sync on my work and home computer, including syncing add-ons.

I was testing limited add-on installation to approved add-ons in our enterprise on my work computer and inadvertently removed all of my extensions. Without thinking it through I performed a manual Firefox sync on my work computer, which I fear has synced the extension removal to Firefox sync (the opposite of what I wanted to happen).

When I got home I immediately removed add-ons from Firefox Sync, fortunately it seems before any changes synced to my home computer. So I have all of my original add-ons on my home computer, with add-on sync turned OFF.

What's the easiest way of restoring the extensions to my work computer from my home computer? If I enable sync of add-ons on my home computer, will it

  1. sync my good add-on configuration from my home computer to my work computer, or
  2. sync my bad add-on configuration from my work computer to my home computer?

title: Clicking pinned vertical tabs doesn't focus the page
content:
I've switched to vertical tabs as soon as they became available, and although I prefer using them, at the moment there is an annoying issue with them. If you have one or several pinned tabs, clicking one of them does show the corresponding page, but you can't interact with it until you click into it. To reproduce, have at least one pinned tab and a normal one. If you click on a normal tab and then press "Tab", the focus will start jumping between elements that are focusable. But if you click on a pinned tab, pressing "Tab" will first jump through the tab bar a few times before finally getting to the page: First, the tab itself will get the focus, then the "New tab" button, then the "Customize sidebar" gear icon, and only then does the focus move to the page itself.

What's annoying about it in practice is that one of my pinned tabs is a site that uses keyboard shortcuts for interaction, and whenever I click on it and start pressing keys, nothing happens. Then I have to click into the page once to move the focus to it, and only then does it become usable again.

So, it would be great if pinned tabs would behave the same way as normal ones, immediately focusing the page when clicked.
creator: hckmnn

title: Firefox Caching Menu Pages Too Aggressively – How to Set Better Cache Rules?
content:
Hi Firefox community,

I run a food-related site https://5guyzmenu.com that displays fast food menus (like burger prices, combos, etc.) which update regularly. I've noticed that Firefox often shows a cached version of certain pages (especially /menu/) even after we update them with fresh pricing or item changes.

We use proper cache-control headers and Cloudflare as our CDN, but Firefox still seems to hold onto old versions longer than expected — unless users do a hard refresh (Ctrl+F5).

Has anyone dealt with this issue on dynamic sites?

Does Firefox handle cache differently from Chrome for max-age, no-store, or ETag?

Is there a known bug or setting related to aggressive caching in recent versions?

Would love to hear your thoughts or recommendations from anyone who has faced this with frequently-updated content.

Thanks in advance!
creator: jasonmillerfoodie
